Engineering Projects

From my undergraduate years

Illinois Solar Decathlon

During my time in UIUC Solar Decathlon in 2016, I had the honor of being selected to be a team member representing UIUC for the Race-to-Zero Student Design Competition 2015. We were 1 of 4 grand winning teams that year.

  • Competition Info

Race To Zero Student Design Competition 2015

Illinois Solar Decathlon (ISD) assembled a team of 28 engineers and architects to assess and design a complete energy retrofit of an existing home at Allerton Park, a University of Illinois property. The Sun Catcher Cottage design project provides the proper construction drawings, energy analysis and financial plan necessary to allow the Allerton Park Board of Directors to move forward with the renovation process. In addition, this full set of construction drawings was in compliance with the U.S. Department of Energy's Race to Zero competition. Over several months, this project team has participated in several webinars and training session in order to qualify. Following a review with Skidmore Owings and Merrill in Chicago, the ISD projects team submit Sun Catcher drawings to the U.S. Department of Energy for the Race to Zero Student Design Competition 2015.

My Contribution

As a LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) Green Associate, I had the key ability of leading the team to successfully achieving or surpassing LEED building standards in our project design. This qualified me to be a key member of the Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning (HVAC) Energy Analysis Team.

SWE Team Tech Competition 2014

At the annual SWE National conference, a Team Tech Competition is held and consists of collegiate SWE groups working with a sponsor to engineer an innovative design for a specified product in a year-long effort. In 2015, SWE Illinois was sponsored by John Deere to design a cost-effective, durable, and ergonomic tractor seat.

My Contribution

I used my CAD skills to help with the design of the tractor seat and helped calculate costs for our proposed tractor seat.

Cozad New Venture Competition 2014

The Cozad New Venture Competition is designed to encourage students to create new businesses. Teams are invited to create a venture around a topic of their choice. The competition process offers teams assistance in the form of: mentors to help guide them through the phases of venture creation, workshops to help with idea validation, pitching skills, customer development, and more as well as and courses to enhance their skills and knowledge. In my freshman year of college, a group of friends and I attempted our own start-up by submitting our idea to the Cozad New Venture Competition 2014. We came out in the top 50 semifinalists out of 200 participating groups.

My Contribution

I designed our simple insulin pump concept in Autodesk Inventor.
